website_summaries.verdict: Hands down the best model available – its competitors can't come close to its performance and durability.
pros: A rugged tool that heats up quickly to provide industrial-strength power
Has 200 to 400 degree Fahrenheit temperature control
cons: A set of extra specialty nozzles are available, but you have to purchase it separately

customer_reviews.title: Best Gule Gun Beyond Imagination
customer_reviews.text: WHERE HAVE YOU BEEN ALL MY LIFE!!! I bought the 100 Watt for myself and the 220 Watt for my dad, I'm so envious of my dad. It's crazy how well & quickly the 100 Watt version works, I'm still going to have to upgrade to the 220 Watt version for myself. The 100 Watt is magnitudes better than any other glue gun I've ever used, still the 220 Watt version is a must have.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cadwallader

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: This is a great high quality tool. We use this everyday in our shipping department to glue box bottoms prior to shipping. We ship several dozen boxes it runs 24x7 rarely shutting it off. This one is actually a replacement for the exact same previous one I purchased that lasted over four years of non-stop use. An excellent buy with reliable life. I bought again because it is that good.
customer_reviews.author: Threeriverstool

customer_reviews.title: This gun has been performing flawlessly for over two years ...
customer_reviews.text: This gun has been performing flawlessly for over a year now. Probably gets fired up 4-5 times a month for light duty use so my review isn't as meaningful as someone who's using it everyday, but I thought I'd drop this here anyway. Two years now, still works great.
customer_reviews.author: BRtF

customer_reviews.title: This tool gets the glue extremely hot and therefore a better flow of the glue and a subsequent better hold
customer_reviews.text: I had been using my wife's craft store glue gun in my wood shop for a number of projects but realize that that gun didn't get the glue hot enough for the type of tasks I used it for. This tool gets the glue extremely hot and therefore a better flow of the glue and a subsequent better hold. Incredibly expensive relative to what it is but I'm now starting to come to believe it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: John R.

customer_reviews.title: a real tool...
customer_reviews.text: This gun is the real thing... It comes in a plastic carrying case with room for extra nozzles, glue sticks, and accessories... It's worth the price (I paid $107) and just opening it up and looking at it makes you realize that there are more possibilities for using hot melt glue than you ever thought of when you had one of those "craft store" type glue guns in your hand...
customer_reviews.author: Pythagoras

customer_reviews.title: Coveted by all hot glue users who try it
customer_reviews.text: Heats up quickly and dispenses hot glue without much mess. With the adjustable setscrew, it can be configured to make very repeatable blobs of glue. Adjustable temperature lets you balance working time against how long it takes to re-solidify. Light up switch lets you keep it plugged in and tell at a glance if you've left it on.
customer_reviews.author: Benedict J. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Very NICE! Really needs the extra nozzles included
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice glue gun with an adequate case. Hunted around for the listed series 6000 nozzles, nothing turns up. There is a set of #100 nozzles but compatibility not mentioned. This really should have just come complete with all the nozzles.
customer_reviews.author: UKMerlin

customer_reviews.title: Ehhhhh,... Just ok
customer_reviews.text: I had a little bit of trouble first time I used this item the glue advancement feature isn't the best but certainly is a terrible either I just would have expected a little better for um this pricey of a glue gun
customer_reviews.author: R. Ashby

customer_reviews.title: lost it and replaced it with $50 models--big mistake and a waste of $50
customer_reviews.text: This is worth the price. I had one of these, lost it and replaced it with $50 models--big mistake and a waste of $50. This gun works so much better than cheaper guns. Sometimes it pays too buy a better tool
customer_reviews.author: WD

customer_reviews.title: Professional Tool
customer_reviews.text: It's been a while since I bought it. We are using it everyday 8 hours in the workshop. - No problems at all. - Short warm up time. - Good temperature controller ( The hot melting glue does not becomes over-heated and is not yellowing. - It can deliver continuously big amounts of glue if needed. - The different exchangeable nozzles makes this tool really versatile.
customer_reviews.author: no_name

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra $$$
customer_reviews.text: Pricey and worth it. Best glue gun ever. I tossed out my cheapies.
customer_reviews.author: Lalo

customer_reviews.title: happy customer
customer_reviews.text: Just as described,and in my opinion better. I use the hot glue gun a lot,and I think it's great.It's a heavy duty glue gun probably not what most of you are use to seeing in crafts ans home supply stores. Great investment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SO FAR SO GOOD!!
customer_reviews.text: SO FAR SO GOOD!!! Heats up quick, and always has enough glue to keep on working. I have had cheap ones......and you get what you pay for!!! (most of the time)
customer_reviews.author: dont ask

customer_reviews.title: Even if you are not a heavy Glue Gun User...
customer_reviews.text: The VERY Fast warm-up time, ability to chew through stick after stick without pause and the intrinsic feeling of quality make this a GREAT tool to have. Even if you don't use it that often. Nuff Said!
customer_reviews.author: Flipper

customer_reviews.title: Very good glue gun.
customer_reviews.text: This product works great and does a good job. The case is nice.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my husband. He loves this glue gun and controls
customer_reviews.author: PMay

customer_reviews.title: Best I have seen
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good in our business we need to lay down lots of glue in a hurry to glue edging to tabletops before we epoxy. This is the best solution we have found but even faster would be better
customer_reviews.author: Bob Mueller

customer_reviews.title: no messy waste, other than small amount at start up
customer_reviews.text: works just as stated!!! no messy waste, other than small amount at start up.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy T.

customer_reviews.title: Great Glue Gun
customer_reviews.text: Great Glue Gun. Heats up very quickly and can produce hot glue faster than I can work. I used it during a home renovation to secure heating elements from an in-floor heating system in place prior to applying the cement and tiles, it worked great. I used it at medium temperature and it works great. Very high quality professional unit.
customer_reviews.author: TjaltzNY

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: This glue gun is amazing. It gets really hot very quickly and is very smooth to use. One of the best features is that it does not leak glue when it is sitting on the table hot. A lot of cheaper guns the glue continues to ooze out, not this gun. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: jared

customer_reviews.title: This is the glue gun to invest in!
customer_reviews.text: Needed a well-made, quality glue gun that I could depend on for many years to come. Found it. Great investment! Some Things I Love: ** the on/off switch ** how quickly it heats up and is ready to use ** dial to adjust the temperature ** it’s self-standing (great for when you could really use more than two hands!) ** the storage/carrying case
customer_reviews.author: Amanda G

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: working great but i seen exactly once in home depot $18 dollars cheaper than your.

customer_reviews.title: Best glue gun ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best hot glue gun I ever used. The warm up time is short and the stick advance mechanism is excellent. No more low quality guns for me.
customer_reviews.author: GS

customer_reviews.title: you gotta be pretty quick it sets up pretty fast
customer_reviews.text: works well for what I use it for and that's glueing down Transition strips to concrete, you gotta be pretty quick it sets up pretty fast though
customer_reviews.author: Billy D

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Premium Price.
customer_reviews.text: Best of the hot glue guns. Worth the extra money over the cheap versions.

customer_reviews.title: very nice glue gun
customer_reviews.text: very nice gun, but the glue sticks slip a little.
customer_reviews.author: Ken B.

customer_reviews.title: Awsome!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome glue gun and well worth the money. Regulating the heat makes it very versatile. A must for the heavy duty crafter.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Hetherman

customer_reviews.title: I love it. Easy to use and the housing doesn't ...
customer_reviews.text: I love it. Easy to use and the housing doesn't get hot like smaller cheaper models.
customer_reviews.author: Hot Sauce

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great, no leaking, adjustable temp, heats up in about 1 minute. Saves a lot of time.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan A

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: Works like a champ. Outside gets a little hot on high, but it is a hot glue gun so..... Pretty easy to use. The handle and controls stay cool even after being on for hours. Doesn't drip much. Very happy! I bought the extra nozzles. I'm not sure those are needed. The stand does a good job of holding the gun up, but the gun is light so it is easy to knock over. Works fine in any orientation, but beware of dripping. Warning: The temptation to hot glue everything is strong :)
customer_reviews.author: Mike Miller

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I like quality products so I feel this was worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tool, I can't think of a way to improve it

customer_reviews.title: Fast heating up and easy, steady trigger
customer_reviews.text: Fast heating up and easy, steady trigger. Will also use 1/2" slicks. Nice plastic case with space for sticks included.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A real pro tool in a sea of garbage toys.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great glue gun
customer_reviews.text: This is a great glue gun. The only problem I have had is the built in check valve doesn't seem to last very long before it starts leaking
customer_reviews.author: Cadmark

customer_reviews.title: works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I used this to glue down about a mile of electric wire for a radiant floor heating system. It worked perfectly. Cheaper versions don't even come close!
customer_reviews.author: Washington & Lee

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: its quick on the draw. it is a well built glue gun.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Not at all cheap feeling and should last a long time.
customer_reviews.text: This glue gun is a lot pricier than many but the quality is well worth it if you can afford it. My habit is usually to buy cheap then get frustrated when it dies in short time. That won't happen with this and I have the sense this will last longer than me. It heats up fast and though I've not yet used the adjustable heat I'm glad to have the option. So far the problem of other glue guns with dripping hot glue hasn't happened with this.
customer_reviews.author: BJS, Bozeman, MT

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. Heated up fast and stayed consistent throughout the project.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine J. Bigrigg

customer_reviews.title: Nice to not have to leave in a specific place ...
customer_reviews.text: Made in taiwan, first time ever a glue gun that doesn't drip. Still strings/webs with use but that is no big deal considering it doesn't drip. Have only had it for a short period of time but every other gun I have had dripped within an hour or two of overall use. Nice to not have to leave in a specific place and the self standing wire attachment isn't in the way that much.
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: Love this!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best investment in my lifetime of glue guns. I craft and use flute guns all the time. This had made my hobby so much better. It doesn't leak glue every where, the large glue sticks are a plus and the cord is long enough to where I don't have to sit next to a wall. You won't regret this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Diana Rjs

customer_reviews.title: Feeds nice. The wire stand is stable yet it does ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this daily to seal cardboard packages for shipping. Fast warm up. Feeds nice. The wire stand is stable yet it does not hinder your work. Luv the illuminated on / off switch. All the cheap glue guns I've bought have long been in the trash. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: bdockett

customer_reviews.title: It heats up super fast & the smaller tip gets in smaller spaces
customer_reviews.text: My husband uses this for his business & loves it! It heats up super fast & the smaller tip gets in smaller spaces.
customer_reviews.author: Jasnxtc

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like this so far. I just hope it lasts as it seems to be a flimsy build.
customer_reviews.author: Yaya

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: V E R Y good unit, good quality and nice build. This unit can deliver a good amount of melted glue witch is very important when you need volume. I used to go for Ad Tech from wall Mart, they are good for little work and age quite badly (the plastic parts are burning even though i had a power switch to limit the heat as much as possible) I like this to come with a nice and sturdy valise. This is just a good unit. Nothing bad for me so far
customer_reviews.author: Guy

customer_reviews.title: Husband loves it!! He uses it to piece ...
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves it!! He uses it to piece together our LOR strands.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool to work with
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tool to work with. Easy to handle, the temperature control works as it should - I couldn't be happier with it.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Hot!!!
customer_reviews.text: Smoking hot glue gun, with adjustable temp setting!!! I usually leave it on the low setting for most work but turned up I don't know if I could use the glue as fast as it heats it up at... Careful

customer_reviews.title: Great glue gun
customer_reviews.text: So far so good..Heats quick..on and if switch a plus. Temp adjuster a must...Works perfect so far

product_meta.title: Surebonder PRO2-220 220 Watt Adjustable Temperature Professional Heavy Duty Hot Glue Gun - Uses full size, 7/16" sticks
product_meta.description: The PRO2-220 Industrial adjustable temperature heavy duty glue gun is designed for high volume applications. Delivers approximately 5-Pounds of glue per hour with 220 watts of heating power. The stainless steel heater with an adjustable temperature control from 220° F to 420° F. The gun features a lighted ON/OFF switch, a double insulated grounded cord, two nozzles with protective heat resistant nozzle covers, a detachable wire stand, an integrated gun balancer mount hole and a glue stroke adjustment screw. This gun uses standard (1/2",7/16", 0.43") diameter glue sticks. Specialty nozzles also available separately-Surebonder Nozzle Set #6000. Not included with this gun.
feature_bullets: Specialty nozzles are available; Surebonder Nozzle Set #6000 (not included with this gun)

specifications.Included Components: Glue Stroke Adjustment Screw, Extra Nozzle, Detachable Wire Stand
